products.name: Shopify Payments - D2C Plus, Shopify for ent, CCS

salesforce.ae_next_steps: [AS] 16.01 Technical discovery scheduled for 26.01 + intro to deal champion, Chris Turberville-Tulley

narratives.opp_summary: Moss Bros. Group Ltd is a new business opportunity in the Envision stage with an annual deal value of $82,800 and a 3-year total revenue impact of $2,129,400. The deal involves D2C Standard Plus with Shopify Payments attached ($25.35M GPV against $39M D2C GMV). The opportunity was created on January 16, 2026, with a projected close date of September 30, 2026, currently at 20% probability with merchant intent listed as Uncommitted.
narratives.why_change: Not discussed in available calls. No call transcripts are available, and the Salesforce data does not include a compelling event or specific pain points driving the evaluation. The AE next steps reference a "technical discovery" session and an introduction to a deal champion (Chris Turberville-Tulley), suggesting early-stage qualification is still underway. Without transcripts or documented business pain, the reasons for evaluating a platform change remain unknown at this time.
narratives.why_shopify: Not discussed in available calls. The Salesforce data confirms Moss Bros. is evaluating Shopify Plus with D2C Standard and Shopify Payments, but no competitive context, feature-specific interest, or comparison notes are documented. No competitor field is populated, and position vs. competitor is blank. A demo was booked for February 25, 2026, which may begin to surface why Shopify is being considered, but no evidence exists yet.
narratives.why_now: Not discussed in available calls. No compelling event is documented in Salesforce. The close date of September 30, 2026, suggests a roughly 8-month sales cycle was projected at opportunity creation, but there is no indication of what external business event, contract renewal, or internal pressure is driving the timeline. This is a critical gap that needs to be addressed in upcoming discovery sessions.
narratives.support_needed: Complete technical discovery to understand Moss Bros.' current tech stack, pain points, and migration requirements. Introduction to and engagement with the identified deal champion, Chris Turberville-Tulley. Demo delivery (booked for February 25, 2026) tailored to Moss Bros.' D2C and payments use cases. Identification and documentation of compelling event and urgency drivers. Competitive landscape assessment — no competitors currently identified.

questions.text: Have you identified the business reasons driving the migration?
questions.notes: AE notes reference 'technical discovery' suggesting migration is being explored, but no specific business reasons are documented.
questions.solution: Use upcoming discovery and demo sessions to uncover and document specific business drivers.
questions.action: AE to document business migration reasons after technical discovery call.

questions.text: Have you identified quantifiable goals?
questions.notes: No quantifiable goals (revenue targets, conversion improvements, cost savings) are documented anywhere.
questions.solution: Ask champion and stakeholders about KPIs they expect to improve with a platform change.
questions.action: AE to prepare metrics-focused discovery questions for next stakeholder meeting.

questions.text: Has merchant confirmed current solution cannot achieve goals?
questions.notes: The fact that they are evaluating Shopify Plus suggests they believe a platform change may be needed, but this has not been explicitly confirmed.
questions.solution: Validate whether incremental improvements to current stack were considered vs. full replatform.
questions.action: AE to ask directly whether they've considered staying on current platform with modifications.

questions.text: Do you know what happens if they fail to achieve their goals?
questions.notes: No information on what happens if they fail to achieve their goals or don't migrate.
questions.solution: Explore cost of inaction during next discovery session.
questions.action: AE to document 'cost of doing nothing' during champion conversation.

questions.text: Is there a compelling event driving action?
questions.notes: Compelling Event field is null. No deadline, renewal, or business trigger documented.
questions.solution: Uncover whether there is a contract renewal, board mandate, or business event forcing a decision.
questions.action: AE to explicitly ask about contract timelines and business deadlines in next call.

questions.text: Have the metrics been validated by merchant?
questions.notes: No metrics have been identified, so none have been validated.
questions.solution: Once metrics are identified, validate them with the economic buyer or champion.
questions.action: Defer until metrics are established.

questions.text: Are metrics compelling enough to justify change?
questions.notes: Without identified metrics, cannot assess if they are compelling enough to justify change.
questions.solution: Build a business case with quantified impact once metrics are gathered.
questions.action: SA/SE to prepare ROI framework once discovery data is available.

questions.text: Have you identified who can spend unbudgeted funds?
questions.notes: Only one stakeholder listed (Brett Grobler) with no title or role. Deal champion Chris Turberville-Tulley referenced but not in stakeholder list. True economic buyer unknown.
questions.solution: Map the org chart and identify who holds budget authority for technology decisions.
questions.action: AE to ask champion who the budget holder and final decision-maker is.

questions.text: Do you know who will sign the contract?
questions.notes: No information on who will sign the contract.
questions.solution: Confirm contract signatory during procurement discussions.
questions.action: AE to ask champion about contract signing authority.

questions.text: Have you engaged directly with the EB?
questions.notes: No evidence of access to the economic buyer. We don't even know who it is yet.
questions.solution: Use champion relationship to map path to economic buyer.
questions.action: AE to request introduction to economic buyer through Chris Turberville-Tulley.

questions.text: Has champion provided a path to the EB?
questions.notes: AE notes mention an 'intro to deal champion, Chris Turberville-Tulley' which could be a path to the economic buyer, but this is speculative.
questions.solution: Leverage champion introduction to build upward access.
questions.action: AE to confirm champion intro happened and plan EB introduction.

questions.text: Do you know what the EB cares about?
questions.notes: No information about what the economic buyer cares about.
questions.solution: Research Moss Bros. public statements, annual reports, and ask champion about EB priorities.
questions.action: AE to research EB priorities and prepare targeted messaging.

questions.text: Do you understand their budget process?
questions.notes: No information about their decision-making process or budget allocation methods.
questions.solution: Ask champion how technology decisions and budgets are typically approved.
questions.action: AE to include budget/decision process questions in next champion conversation.

questions.text: Have you mapped their full decision process?
questions.notes: No documented decision process. The opportunity is in Envision stage with early discovery activities.
questions.solution: Map the full decision process including evaluation steps, approvals, and timeline.
questions.action: AE to ask champion to walk through how they've made similar technology decisions in the past.

questions.text: Have you identified all decision-makers?
questions.notes: Brett Grobler listed as stakeholder and Chris Turberville-Tulley referenced as champion, but no full buying committee mapped.
questions.solution: Build a complete stakeholder map with roles, influence levels, and positions on Shopify.
questions.action: AE to ask champion who else is involved in the evaluation and decision.

questions.text: Is the timeline customer-driven or AE-estimated?
questions.notes: Close date is September 30, 2026, but unclear if customer-driven or AE-estimated.
questions.solution: Validate whether the customer has a target decision date and what's driving it.
questions.action: AE to confirm customer's desired decision timeline in next meeting.

questions.text: Do you know what's driving the timeline?
questions.notes: No information on what's driving the timeline. Compelling event is null.
questions.solution: Uncover external or internal drivers for the September timeline.
questions.action: AE to ask what business event or deadline is associated with their platform decision.

questions.text: Have they previously attempted to solve this?
questions.notes: No information on whether Moss Bros. has previously attempted to solve this problem.
questions.solution: Ask about previous replatforming attempts or evaluations.
questions.action: AE to include 'have you tried to solve this before?' in discovery questions.

questions.text: What happens if they maintain the status quo?
questions.notes: No information on what happens if they maintain the status quo.
questions.solution: Explore and document the consequences of inaction.
questions.action: AE to discuss cost of inaction with champion and stakeholders.

questions.text: Has the decision process been validated?
questions.notes: No decision process has been identified yet, so none has been validated.
questions.solution: Once process is mapped, validate it with champion and ideally the economic buyer.
questions.action: Defer until decision process is mapped.

questions.text: Have you identified their evaluation criteria?
questions.notes: No evaluation criteria documented. No competitor listed.
questions.solution: Ask what criteria they are using to evaluate platforms and who defined them.
questions.action: AE to ask champion for their evaluation criteria / RFP requirements.

questions.text: Do you understand their technical requirements?
questions.notes: Products listed are D2C Standard only. Unclear if omnichannel needs discussed or ruled out.
questions.solution: Explore whether Moss Bros. has omnichannel needs (retail stores, B2B wholesale).
questions.action: SA to include omnichannel capability discussion in demo or follow-up discovery.

questions.text: Have you documented integration requirements?
questions.notes: Technical discovery scheduled for January 26 likely surfaced requirements, but no outcomes documented.
questions.solution: Document technical discovery findings including current integrations, ERP, OMS, PIM, etc.
questions.action: SA/SE to document and share technical discovery outcomes.

questions.text: Have payments requirements been discussed?
questions.notes: Shopify Payments attached ($25.35M GPV out of $39M GMV = ~65% attachment), suggesting payments were discussed. No details on current payment setup.
questions.solution: Understand current PSP, rates, and what would drive a payments switch.
questions.action: AE/SA to discuss payments requirements and compare to current provider.

questions.text: Is there a mutual action plan?
questions.notes: No mutual action plan documented.
questions.solution: Create a mutual action plan with the champion after discovery is complete.
questions.action: AE to propose a mutual action plan with key milestones and dates.

questions.text: Have you shaped the decision criteria?
questions.notes: Without knowing the criteria, we cannot assess whether we've shaped them.
questions.solution: Once criteria are known, identify areas where Shopify differentiates.
questions.action: SA to prepare competitive positioning once criteria are identified.

questions.text: Do you know who defined the criteria?
questions.notes: No information on who defined the decision criteria.
questions.solution: Ask who is leading the evaluation and who defined the requirements.
questions.action: AE to ask champion about the origin of evaluation criteria.

questions.text: Have you identified their procurement process?
questions.notes: No procurement process information documented. Envision stage, may be premature but should start exploring.
questions.solution: Begin light procurement discovery to understand typical buying processes.
questions.action: AE to ask champion about typical procurement timelines and processes.

questions.text: Do you know potential legal/commercial redlines?
questions.notes: No information about potential legal or commercial redlines.
questions.solution: Understand their legal review process and common sticking points.
questions.action: AE to ask about legal review requirements in future conversations.

questions.text: How long does legal review typically take?
questions.notes: No data on legal review duration.
questions.solution: Gather information on past technology contract reviews.
questions.action: Defer until procurement process is understood.

questions.text: What is the overall procurement timeline?
questions.notes: No information on overall procurement timeline.
questions.solution: Build procurement timeline into mutual action plan.
questions.action: Include in mutual action plan development.

questions.text: Have contract details been discussed?
questions.notes: No contract details discussed. Early Envision stage.
questions.solution: Prepare contract terms aligned with deal structure once deal progresses.
questions.action: Defer until deal advances past Envision stage.

questions.text: Has a contract been sent?
questions.notes: No contract sent. Early Envision stage.
questions.solution: N/A at this stage.
questions.action: Defer until appropriate stage.

questions.text: Is there a target signature date?
questions.notes: No target signature date beyond close date of September 30, 2026.
questions.solution: Validate whether September 30 is realistic and work backward from desired go-live.
questions.action: AE to discuss go-live expectations and work backward to required signature date.

questions.text: What are their current pain points?
questions.notes: No current issues or reasons for reviewing tech stack documented.
questions.solution: Technical discovery (scheduled Jan 26) should have surfaced this — need to document findings.
questions.action: AE/SA to document pain points from technical discovery session.

questions.text: Have they tried to resolve these issues before?
questions.notes: No information on previous attempts to resolve issues.
questions.solution: Ask about past replatforming or optimization efforts.
questions.action: AE to explore history of tech stack changes in next call.

questions.text: How do current pains affect business operations?
questions.notes: No documentation of how current pains affect business operations.
questions.solution: Quantify business impact of current platform issues.
questions.action: AE to ask about revenue impact, operational costs, and team productivity effects.

questions.text: Which teams are affected?
questions.notes: No information on which teams are affected.
questions.solution: Map affected teams and their specific pain points.
questions.action: AE to explore cross-functional impact in discovery.

questions.text: Is there genuine urgency to solve?
questions.notes: No urgency indicators. Compelling event null. Merchant intent Uncommitted.
questions.solution: Uncover whether there is genuine urgency or if this is an exploratory evaluation.
questions.action: AE to directly assess urgency level and commitment to action.

questions.text: What alternatives are being considered?
questions.notes: No information on alternative solutions. Competitor fields all null.
questions.solution: Ask directly about other vendors being evaluated or internal build options.
questions.action: AE to ask 'who else are you evaluating?' in next conversation.

questions.text: Why is solving this important now?
questions.notes: No information on why solving this problem is important now.
questions.solution: Connect platform pain to current business priorities and strategic objectives.
questions.action: AE to ask what has changed that makes this evaluation necessary now.

questions.text: Is Shopify uniquely positioned to solve?
questions.notes: Shopify Plus with Payments is being evaluated, suggesting some alignment, but no specific unique positioning evidence exists.
questions.solution: Develop a clear narrative on why Shopify is uniquely positioned for Moss Bros.
questions.action: SA to prepare tailored value proposition after discovery is complete.

questions.text: Have you identified a champion?
questions.notes: AE notes reference Chris Turberville-Tulley as 'deal champion' and intro was planned. However, champion is not in stakeholder list and no evidence of champion behavior exists.
questions.solution: Validate champion status by testing whether Chris is actively helping advance the deal.
questions.action: AE to confirm intro to Chris happened and assess champion qualities.

questions.text: What is the champion's role and influence?
questions.notes: Chris Turberville-Tulley's role, title, and political capital are unknown.
questions.solution: Understand Chris's position, tenure, and influence within the organization.
questions.action: AE to research Chris's role and ask about their standing.

questions.text: Has the champion shared insider insights?
questions.notes: No evidence of insider insights being shared. No call transcripts available.
questions.solution: Use upcoming interactions to test whether champion provides internal intelligence.
questions.action: AE to ask champion about internal dynamics, competing priorities, and decision-maker preferences.

questions.text: How does the champion connect to the EB?
questions.notes: Brett Grobler is listed stakeholder; Chris is referenced champion. Connection to key decision-makers unclear.
questions.solution: Map the relationship between Brett, Chris, and the economic buyer.
questions.action: AE to ask Chris about the internal reporting structure and decision chain.

questions.text: Has champion introduced you to the EB?
questions.notes: No evidence of introduction to the decision-maker. Economic buyer not identified.
questions.solution: Request introduction to economic buyer through champion.
questions.action: AE to ask Chris for introduction to the person who will ultimately approve the deal.

questions.text: Will the champion bring Shopify into internal meetings?
questions.notes: No evidence of willingness to bring Shopify into internal meetings.
questions.solution: Test champion's willingness by requesting participation in internal review.
questions.action: AE to ask champion if Shopify can present to the broader evaluation team.

questions.text: What motivates the champion personally?
questions.notes: No information on why Chris would champion Shopify internally. Personal motivation unknown.
questions.solution: Understand what Chris personally gains from a successful Shopify migration.
questions.action: AE to explore Chris's personal and professional motivations in next 1:1.

questions.text: Have you identified all competitors?
questions.notes: All competitor fields in Salesforce are null. No competitors identified.
questions.solution: Directly ask who else is being evaluated. Research current platform.
questions.action: AE to ask 'who else are you looking at?' and research current tech stack.

questions.text: Is 'do nothing' a viable competitor?
questions.notes: No evidence that 'doing nothing' has been explored. Merchant intent Uncommitted — this is a real risk.
questions.solution: Directly ask whether staying on current platform is viable.
questions.action: AE to ask champion what happens if they decide not to change platforms.

questions.text: Are there internal alternatives (build vs buy)?
questions.notes: No information on internal alternatives.
questions.solution: Ask about internal development capabilities and build-vs-buy considerations.
questions.action: AE to explore build-vs-buy considerations.

questions.text: Why are alternatives being evaluated?
questions.notes: No information on why alternatives are being evaluated.
questions.solution: Understand what triggered the evaluation and what each alternative offers.
questions.action: AE to ask what prompted the search and criteria differentiating options.

questions.text: Do you have a competitive win strategy?
questions.notes: No competitive positioning or win/loss factors documented.
questions.solution: Develop clear competitive strategy once competitors and criteria are known.
questions.action: SA to prepare competitive battle cards once competitors are identified.
